title: Okay lunch
text: I knew Pacific Catch is known for fresh seafood and I selected Walnut Creek location as our mid-point for lunch. We both saw the garage across the street and parked under 3 hours for free. Observing covid-19 codes, tables were spaced apart, everyone was masked, and attentive. I was disenchanted with my fish 'n chips because the fish pieces were half the size compared with the photos. Generous helping with the fries though, flavorful coleslaw, and the fish was fresh and hot. Meeting my friend was the highlight of our lunch.

title: Great take-out
text: Our friend called in our orders for pickup at noon. We arrived early and greeter was very friendly and told us they will get the order done. While waiting, several pickups came/went--the service was quick, efficient with a smile. Our order was ready and they added a wonderful double chocolate biscotti for my bday. The fried chicken was delectable; crunchy skin, moist meat, and yummy/full flavor. What a nice lunch!

title: Wonderful lunch
text: Via a review, open for dine-in now, we were welcomed and seated a table away from other diners, and were given extra napkins and iced water. Menu offered many variety dishes, even sukiyaki. The crispy chicken was very good but the ginger garlic rice lack flavor. The calamari rings were fried just right but missing the "legs". My drunken noodles came out hot and was tasty, shrimp was fresh. The service was attentive and there was a lot of take out orders which may have delayed our dishes. The freshness, flavors, cuisine, and service are incentives to come back when we are in Vacaville.
place: Rice Barn Thai Eatery and Wine Bar

title: Special Occasion Site
text: Open Table's confirmation email attached Skates' menu and my mind was set Fettuccini. My party of 6 was fantastic served by Michael. I showed the manager the menu which she said it was very old and she will contact Open Table. The calamari and artichoke appetizers were delicious. 2 of our friends had the mahi mahi specials which they liked. The braised shortribs, fish/chips, and seafood Louie were generous portioned but we had the old menu choices in mind. Skates' 35th Anniversary pre fixe was only for dinner. The waterfront view was spectacular. There was an enforcement vehicle in the corner of the parking lot when we left.

title: Homestyle cafe
text: An old establishment with country home charm that serves breakfasts. We were greeted and seated right away and offered coffee. The ladies served us efficiently. My order was 2 just right scrambled fluffy eggs, 3 large sausage links, crispy hash browns, and yummy 2 large dollar size light pancakes. I enjoyed mine but my husband said his gravy over his chicken fried steak over waffles didn't have any taste. Our friend's "Joe's Special" omelette looked good. We were lucky to find street parking, no waiting in line, and glad to try this breakfast cafe.

title: Excellent!
text: Had this restaurant on my list, was referred by our tour guide who helped us made our reservations for 6. Short walk from Hilton, was welcomed warmly, sat outside, and service was very attentive. Our first "Greek" meal was fabulous; cooked just right crispy calamari, grilled octopus & sardine salads, carbonara/smoked bacon, generous roast suckling pig, with complimentary soup and lemoncello slushie for dessert. A marvelous and memorable meal on our first night in Athens. Thank you Oroscopo!

title: Great Museum
text: Our tour guide leads us thru this lovely museum. The highlight was the bronze statue of Zeus. Lots of artifacts and so much information to absord. Glad to see the history, care and pride of Greece.

title: Beautiful
text: Our Parthenon tour included Acropolis and Erechtheion. It was amazing to see how much is still standing. Worth climbing to see up close.

title: Lots to see
text: Wear good walking shoes to walk/shop/eat thru the neighborhood. Can get very crowded and the shops are catered to tourists. Get beyond the Plaka and see where the locals shop and eat.

title: Wonderful
text: We took a tour and were glad and appreciate the conservation and the offer to allow people to see these ancient wonders up close. Not to miss when in Athens.

title: Amazing Recoveries
text: Part of our tour, this museum was very clean and orderly, which had to be for so many tours/people. Very good displays of the artifacts and statues. The caf√© & service was very good too.

title: One of World's Wonders
text: We had one free day before our cruise starts and to not miss the chance to see the Acropolis up close we took a tour, (Chat Tour), which included a coach city tour, Acropolis Museum, and tickets to the Acropolis thus avoiding the ticket line. The weather was great for 9/18, not too hot at 8AM but the hill was packed by 10AM. Would have enjoyed the site if not so many people, got strangers in my photos. Some marble steps are slippery and there were security and guides to handle the people traffic. It was a wonder to see the ancient ruins up close.

title: Fresh Dumplings in "Hole-in-Wall"
text: Fresh Dumpling has been in its soft opening for about a month so the menu is limited. Street parking and restaurant is close to theater, which the food is ideal for lunch, dinner or snack. Many choices of dumplings, green onion pancake, hot/spicy appetizers are made fresh. Service is very attentive. A party of 8 combined the 2 tables together otherwise limited seating. Food was good; no alcohol, hot tea and/or iced water. One noodle dish; beef noodle soup, so hopefully they expand their menu for more variety.

title: Delicious & Good Value
text: Our friends took us here after fishing nearby and the order line was moving at Tuesday 11:30 AM. Many sandwich choices and the service was efficient and accurate to the descriptions. Everyibody loved their big sandwiches which one can feed for two. What a value too because the size and quality of the meat would be twice the price at other delis. The bread was crunchy, soft in the middle, and good flavored. It was a wonderful lunch! Not 5 rating because the person behind the preorder didn't even smile when I politely asked and thank her for refilling the water pitcher.

title: Closeup of a 15th century castle
text: Prior our tour's ride thru the Ring of Kerry drive, we stopped and walked to the ruins of Ross Castle. Walking thru the ruins gave another perspective from viewing from the coach. It's amazing how some of these ancient structures remained standing. Ireland has another of my deep appreciation for its history. Self-guided with a detailed description of Ross Castle's history.

title: Appreciate Ireland's Natiional Park
text: Our tour included a ride thru Killarney National Park and we admired the natural beauty. This month of May had not "Spring" yet, so no heather or colors. Love the "Leprechaan crossing" sign. An enjoyable scenic ride.

title: Exhibit of Ireland history & the Titanic
text: This attraction was included in our tour of Ireland and has proven to be interesting and informative. A modern museum with some hands-on tools for historical experience, a panoramic screen of the Titianic's decks, examples of the era, and the downfall details of the Titanic. A wonderful education of Ireland and the Titanic.

title: A Block From High Street
text: After our city tour and visiting the Edinburgh Castle we walked High Street and discovered the many tunnels and stairways. We found The Doric, walked up more stairs, were greeted, and seated us. I researched The Doric and the cod-fish 'n chips were excellent; the best in our 10 day tour. My Homemade Shepards Pie with snap peas and long beans were delicious, along with half pint Guinness. Service was slow, requested for water and check, but the food was great.

title: Excellent Fish 'n Chips
text: We've become fish 'n chips connoisseurs on this Scotland/Ireland tour. I researched Quinlans at home and our guide recommended it too. Walking distance from our hotel, was greeted and a table of four was ready. Small dining room so the tables were close. The seafood chowder bowl was hearty; fresh fish and fried squid/calamari were cooked just right. Our last fish 'n chips which is added to wonderful memories of this tour.

title: Lovely "Castle Hotel
text: We arrived after viewing the Cliffs of Moher on our tour and had to wait a bit for our group's checkin. Bunratty was our last stay in Ireland and accommodations were top notched. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The Medieval Castle Banquet was included which the show and food was a wonderful experience. We used their laptop under the stairs to checkin and print our boarding passes. Breakfast was more than adequate; all the Scottish fare, fruits, cereal, etc.
place: Bunratty Castle Hotel, BW Signature Collection

title: Yummy Fish 'n Chips
text: Before our tour starts we had lunch here. In an alleyway, up the stairs, Chippy Doon was welcoming, roomy/high ceilings, and clean. Fish 'n chips were great. Service was prompt. A lovely lunch.

title: Good walk for tourists and locals
text: From our hotel it was an easy walk slightly downhill with lots to see, shop, and dine. Mix of old and new buildings with little alleyways. Very spacious boulevard, clean and safe. We walked this street to search for the fish 'n chips restaurant for lunch which we found easily. We also looked into the local's "dollar" and grocery stores. Plazas and other ancient buildings nearby. A fun and interesting walk.

title: Authenic Chinese Food
text: After 12 hours of flying and arriving Glasgow 7:30PM, we wanted to dine close to our hotel. Researched this Chinese restaurant at home and we walked 5 blocks from hotel. Large dining hall and all the Asian decorations. Menu had many selections and the Cantonese dishes were familiar as in the US. Good portions and similar flavors as back home. House soup was comfort food; the duck/bbq pork/roast pork over rice, and tofu/mushroom/black fungus/snap peas dishes were very good. Communication with the waitresses was fine and service was good.

title: Centralized and easy walk
text: A professional and experienced hotel for worldly travelers. The desk welcomed us with warm chocolate cookies. Spacious room, comfortable beds, and provided blankets which we always replaced the heavy down comforters. European tubs seemed to all have high ledges so there were grab bars to use. Breakfast was fantastic, had the "Scottish" porridge, haggis, blood sausage, eggs, sausages, potato scone and coffee at the buffet. Service was excellent. Everything was walking distance; Mark & Spencer for money exchange, City Center for shopping/dining. Wonderful memories of Glasgow--our first day in Scotland.
place: Doubletree by Hilton Hotel Glasgow Central

title: Cozy Pub
text: Down the street from our hotel and also recommended by our tour guide, this pub met my research prior our trip. The lamb shank was the best I have eaten for a long time and the baked cod with herb crust was perfect. Service was attentive and the ambiience was warm and inviting. No desserts though, the Guinness was good.

title: Fresh local fish
text: Parking lot in front of the blue structure, menu overhead which had so much to study as first timers. Gave order to friendly counterpersons, grab sitting in the rolls of picnic benches. Many poke options, flavorful "clam"/seafood chowder, and plate lunches; many locals here for lunch. Will come back.

title: Overrated
text: Our server seated us right away since we were waiting at 10AM. Pang was courteous and accommodating. Limited photo menu which made it easier for new dim sum diners. Dishes were fresh but some lack flavor, quantity was small, but the Jasmine tea we ordered was fabulous. Open air restaurant so watch out for the sparrows. This branch does not match the Hong Kong Michelin star rating. To try once is enough.

title: Met expectations
text: Read about this "new" restaurant in busy Waikiki which is located next door to Laylow Hotel. Industrial setting, menu overhead, order at the counter, get a number and server brings your order to your table. Friendly service and delicious fresh fish dishes. Will be back.

title: Bright, clean and organized
text: We were in the area and checked the Island Princess products here. It looked like they stock all the Island Princess food stuff. Keep in mind the size and price of the item because the same item can be on sale elsewhere. Free parking, complimentary coffee tasting, and clean restrooms.
place: Island Princess Hawaii - Macadamia Nut Factory Outlet

title: Fresh taro chip samples
text: We vistied here while we were in the industrial Sand Island area. They have expanded to across the street which allowed more parking. Not easy to find but sampling fresh taro chips is an experience. Ladies are friendly and are promoting the products.

title: Shopping galore
text: Shopping here is a must in our to do list when visiting Honolulu. I check for Hawaiian souvenirs; bags, gift products, cookies, special event items (Chinese New Year), and food specialties. Many aisles of household and food products. Free parking and open 24 hours.

title: Dim Sum--okay
text: We were looking forward for the "best" dim sum in Honolulu Chinatown. Ginger & Garlic replaced an older dim sum restaurant building. That older dim sum restaurant is nearby. Street parking is tough. Service is welcoming and prompt. Printed menu under table glass top and carts are pushed around. We got some steamed but didn't see the fried dim sum. Some dim sum sizes were smaller and overall flavor is alright. If G&G had a more attractive menu then maybe the selection may be better.

title: Unusual Ice Cream Flavors
text: We missed this ice cream shop last time we were in Honolulu Chinatown because it was closed for vacation. I was greeted and chat with the owner/server who told me this shop will be closed for the whole October. I was lucky to get a single cone of his almond ice cream with cherries and chocolate nips. A nice blend of flavors, not too sweet, nor too creamy rich, just right. I'll try to check Wing SI&IC whenever I'm back in Honolulu Chinatown.

title: Good Value
text: Just flew in, walked Waikiki, had our first meal here. Hole-in-the-wall goodness. Many plate choices. We had the Korean bbq ribs and chicken which came with choices of vegetables, rice, noodles. Satisfied our hunger, ready to walk out again.

title: Backstreet Breakfast Bistro
text: Away from the Waikiki bustle, Hawaiian/Japanese cuisine, this is a charming, welcoming and personal breakfast/lunch restaurant. Although known for their souffl√© pancakes, we had the standard egg/ham/toast/(no rice) and Portuguese Sausage (2) Eggs Benedict with small salad dishes. Both came with crispy outside and soft inside potato cubes. Serviced by Taneka(sp?), and others, was excellent, checking on us and refilling our coffees. The prices were norm. The food was like home cooked, the dining area is clean and not overcrowded which very much appealed to us.

title: Hole in the wall Cantonese comfort food
text: Out in the avenues, street parking, this restaurant has been here for a long time and it shows its wear and tears but it is clean. We come here for Cantonese dumplings (sur gao) in soup and choy sum with either roasted duck of beef stew. The bbq rice plates are a great deal too. Friendly and helpful service and take outs are prompt.

title: Neighborhood Diner
text: We drove around for street parking which road construction was scheduled for the week. When entering Chestnut Diner, we were told to sit by the right wall since the left was "reserved"; apparently for a regular patron. The one cook and one hostess/server could use another help. We waited for our menus and coffees; they were not ready Monday 7AM and more visitors were coming in. Ladies were nice, but nothing special about breakfast to come back.

title: Neighborhood Deli
text: We ordered sandwiches to take out from this old fashioned deli in a liquor store on Irving and 19th. Many selections from the hanging menus. We were greeted by the friendly owner and another person made our 5 sandwiches. We parked across the street so we had time to wait for our order. The "Reuben Sandwich" was hot pastrami with sauerkraut was wonderful. The "Hunter's Club Sandwich" was roast beef generous and very satisfying. My delicious turkey "Frisco Club Sandwich" had fresh lettuce, tomato, avocado, and crispy bacon. Will come back.

title: Just Grand!
text: A rare 5 rating according to my standards because I was very impressed. From the start with the friendly/smiling hostesses by the podium, the buspersons, waiters, all performed excellent service and professionalism, plus the delicious/generous food. They looked happy and showed their willingness with feelings. Our 33 persons birthday party dinner was served with pre fixe menu with perfect fried calamari, large Caesar salad, and 4 entr√©e choices. My braised short ribs was excellent; moist, tender, and flavorful. I would have been happy with tiramisu instead of the butterscotch pudding/Bombolini. A great shout out to the staff and hostesses even though the restroom needed attention.

title: Wonderful Ice Cream
text: This is one of our many stops in this Kalihi district. We arrived before 10:30AM because there's a front parking lot. The counterperson opened the door for us and gave us time to check out the place & flavors. She was very gracious. The Hawaiian Mocha ice cream hit the spot; not too sweet, creamy and chocolaty. The Kona flavor was just as wonderful. If in this area again, I'll get my ice cream fix here.

title: A Lot Better
text: We visited Oahu 22 times and this is our 9th stay at Aqua Palms. We like the Palms since it's centralized between Waikiki and Ala Moana. This older hotel has changed with the times and the service is gracious. We checked in with Rick who provided us with a great room as requested; two beds and lanai. There was a fan in the closet which we appreciated. We were also very happy that the beds had blankets instead of the new trend of using duvets which are too heavy and hot. Thank you Aqua Palms for making our stay in Honolulu comfortable and welcoming. Mahalo!

title: Fantastic Service
text: We were here for Suisun's restaurant week for dinner. This restaurant is in the administration complex and has outdoor seating which was closed (winter) with street parking. No one was at the front desk but we were greeted by a passing staff person. Our waitress gave us a choice and seated us by the window viewing the court. This place is nicely arranged; full bar, tables set apart. We selected from the prix fixe menu. From my 4 star hospitality experience, I graded our waitress' professionalism; her knowledge, timing and attentiveness were perfect. The food was bar type grilled, tasty, and generously portioned. Glad we tried it and I am really impressed with our waitress. I wished all wait staff follow our waitress' service.

title: Restaurant Week Bargain
text: We love It's-It ice cream sandwiches. It was about 4:30PM and the lady behind came right out to greet us as soon she heard the front door's "cow" bells. She explained the Suisun restaurant week special and we wound up buying a case of assorted ice cream. She said the special will last thru end of February. Wonderful deal!

title: Comfy wooden beams, fireplace tavern
text: We dined here for our annual holiday gathering and had great service-wonderful waitress, good drinks, and delicious meal. The "bench booth" fitted six of us comfortably and the waitress checked on us periodically; refilling coffee/drinks. The special was short ribs and it was excellent. My lamb shank melt off the bone and I haven't had a lamb shank this good for a long time. Generous amount of meat, well seasoned, with perfect rice. Not perfect score because the cr√®me brulee dessert was a mini serving. A great establishment for special occasions.

title: Neighborhood Mexican restaurant
text: That day this restaurant was reviewed on TV and we weren't the only ones who saw the program. The place was nearly full at 1PM and the waitress who saw and seated us took orders from 2 other tables who came in after us. We told her we were waiting for 10 minutes, (and for our waters), and she apologized and pushed our orders ahead. This is a mom/pop family run so the cooks and the help were busy; many take out orders too. Generous, (you pay for it), large burritos and entrees. House chips and hot salsas and their sauces are tasty and spicy too. If in the area, may come back for lunch. Street parking is challenging.

title: Farm Raised Abalone
text: Driving north from Monterey, we wanted to check and purchase some fresh abalone. The staff was friendly and informative. Limited parking w/portal potties. They had abalone in tanks. At this time only 4" red abalone and 2+ lb. Dungeness crab were for sale. They provided ice and oxygenized the plastic bags for our purchased. The critters stayed alive for 48 hours in the bags. Very good experience.

title: Local's Dining Spot
text: In a popular strip mall with a large parking lot, this old established coffee shop offers an old fashion menu of favorites. Service is friendly, prompt, and attentive; coffee and water refills. Many booths and tables for 6+ to fit couples and families. A nice stop on Hwy1 before hitting Hwy 92.

title: Wonderful!
text: We had lunch here on Thursday and street parking was not an issue. We were immediately welcome to any table when we enter this small restaurant. Casual and fun artwork on the walls. After reviewing their many selections, (we missed the front door white board listing the specials--should have gotten the crab sandwich), we started with excellent fried calamari, the "French" bread was fresh w/abundant of butter packets, hot chowder with bits of clam and oyster crackers. My Linguini Pescatori was filled with seafood and the fish and chips were cooked just right. If we are in the area again, we would come back.

title: Wonderful
text: I hadn't had a great crab sandwich for ages. My crabwich was a lightly toasted ciabatta with Dungeness crab, lettuce, tomato and delicious rocoto mayo, with cesar salad on the side. My party had the jalea mixta- fried calamari, shrimp, scallop, & fish starter and chicharron de pollo-five spice fried chicken strips--both served with special sauce. The paella was generous for a single serving and was full of seafood, chicken, chorizo and peas. We came early so we were the first to be seated with no waiting. Casual and wonderful Peruvian food.

title: Yummy!
text: We were seated right away for dinner. Many choices of many cuisine--international! I got the wonderful homemade seafood ravioli in tomato sauce. The generous chicken sandwich with fresh sesame bread and clam chowder soup combo were tasty. A very nice local spot with a fantastic bar. Casual and comfortable.

title: Pastries and Coffee
text: The quiche Lorraine pie was huge; loaded with mushrooms, spinach, ham, and flaky crust, and not salty. Quiche pie was phone ordered Monday but was not known for Wednesday AM pick up. They got one from the fridge. We also sampled the lemon creme scone, bacon cheddar biscuit, and delicious Morning Glory muffin. Pastries were not too sweet. Espresso bar is impressive.

title: A Peek of the Incas Life
text: Our Celebrity Machu Picchu program had us tour this park. A great wonderment of Incas' architecture. An attraction not to be missed in the Sacred Valley.

title: Nice Lunch
text: Our Celebrity Machu Picchu program had us for lunch here. It was a very pleasant dining experience; service was fantastic, and wonderful Peruvian lunch and dessert.

title: Old Charm Plaza
text: Our Celebrity Machu Picchu program allowed us to take a few minutes in this beautiful park. Well maintained with cultural decorated benches and trash "bins". A great place to people watch, both locals and those adventurous staying here for their visit.

title: Lots of History
text: Our Celebrity Machu Picchu program provided a tour of the main interior section of this very old cathedral. No photos allowed inside. Lots to take in from the history and the building of this church in those ancient time. Couldn't help compare this Spanish church with European church, this church is rich.

title: Mexican grocery store & deli
text: This taqueria is east of Imola going north on Soscol to central Napa. A little out of the ways but an authentic grocery store of all kinds of Mexican goods. The rear of this clean/organized market is the taqueria which has a billboard menu on the wall behind the cold counters. You give your order, get a ticket, pay up front, then go back for your take out order from the friendly "cook". I got the carnitas super burrito which was a good hefty size, great tasty carnitas, with just enough spice/hotness. Will come back again if in southeast Napa.

title: Beautiful Historic Monastery
text: Our Celebrity Cruise Machu Picchu package booked us in this lovely, old, splendid monastery converted to a hotel. The front door is moderately decorated but as you entered the arched lobby then see the beautiful center garden, the antiqued wall hangings, timely furniture, we were treated with welcoming hospitality. Each guest room is unique. I was surprised with the window shutters, a little balcony w/some view, no a/c but modern amenities and bathroom. A memorable 2 night stay.

title: Wonderment
text: Our Celebrity guide informed us the history of this ancient area. The engineering is amazing. This was a preview of what to see at Machu Picchu.

title: Superb Peruvian Cuisine
text: As part of our Celebrity Machu Picchu tour, we had lunch here and the food and service was as excellent as expected for a Relais & Chateaux establishment. Wayra offered a wide range of the Peruvian food and a Paso horse show of beautiful, well trained horses. I appreciated RM Ichiro Sanchez for acknowledging me as a R&C resort member. Our wonderful lunch was in a large outdoor patio viewing the beautiful mountains.

title: Neat Supermarket
text: I like to visit where the locals shop and Wong is a well known supermarket chain in Lima. We bought our souvenirs; Ecuadorian coffee, Peruvian chocolates, etc., here. I got my recyclable Wong shopping bag too. The staff is friendly and the aisles are well maintained. It was worth the visit.
